Class Winner

java.lang.Object
Winner
public class Winner
extends java.lang.Object
A class used to check, determine and declare a tie or the winner of the game. This class is run after every move, so the tie or the winner is declared at the right moment and no unnecessary moves are played.

    Winner()

  • Constructor Details

      public Winner()

  • Method Details

    • checkWinner

      public static java.lang.String checkWinner​(int gameAreaSize, java.lang.String[][] gameBoard, int inARowFTW)
      A method used to check for a tie and for a winner. This method is run after every move. Three to six in a row needed for the win.
      Parameters:
      gameAreaSize - Is used in for-loops checking for a tie and a winner.
      gameBoard - Is used in for-loops checking for a tie and a winner.
      inARowFTW - This is determined by the user in class ProjectWork. It has the information on how many X's or O's in a row are needed for a win.
      Returns:
      Returns the string winner, which contains information about a tie or a winner or information that tells to continue the game.

    • declareWinner

      public static void declareWinner​(int gameAreaSize, java.lang.String[][] gameBoard)
      A method used to declare a tie or the winner.
      Parameters:
      gameAreaSize - Is used in printing the game board at the end of the game.
      gameBoard - Is used in printing the game board at the end of the game.
